title: First Libyan Civil War
summary: The First Libyan Civil War was an armed conflict in 2011 in the North African country of Libya which was fought between forces which were loyal to Colonel Muammar Gaddafi and rebel groups that were seeking to oust his government.[61][62] It erupted with the Libyan Revolution,[63] also known as the 17 February Revolution.[64] The war was preceded by protests in Zawiya on 8 August 2009 and finally ignited by protests in Benghazi beginning on Tuesday, 15 February 2011, which led to clashes with security forces that fired on the crowd.[65] The protests escalated into a rebellion that spread across the country,[66] with the forces opposing Gaddafi establishing an interim governing body, the National Transitional Council.
